pool.h

00001 /* $Id: pool.h,v 1.4 2003/09/15 12:48:17 jfwan Exp $ */
00002 #ifndef WAN_POOL_H
00003 #define WAN_POOL_H
00004 
00010 #include "general.h"
00011 
00012 EXTERN_TYPE(pool);
00013 
00014 /* pool_cleaner - callback type which is associated
00015  * with a pool entry; invoked when the pool entry is free'd
00016  */
00017 typedef void (*pool_cleaner)(void *arg);
00018 
00019 /* creates a new memory pool with an initial heap size */
00020 pool pool_new(int size);
00021 /* wrapper around malloc, takes from the pool, cleaned up automatically */
00022 void *pmalloc(pool p, int size);
00023 /* Wrapper around pmalloc which prefils buffer with c */
00024 void *pmalloc_x(pool p, int size, char c);
00025 /* YAPW for zeroing the block */
00026 void *pmalloco(pool p, int size);
00027 /* wrapper around strdup, gains mem from pool */
00028 char *pstrdup(pool p, const char *src);
00029 /* temp stub */
00030 char *pstrdupx(pool p, const char *src);
00031 /* calls f(arg) before the pool is freed during cleanup */
00032 void pool_cleanup(pool p, pool_cleaner f, void *arg);
00033 /* calls the cleanup functions, frees all the data on the pool, and deletes the pool itself */
00034 void pool_free(pool p);
00035 /* returns total bytes allocated in this pool */
00036 int pool_size(pool p);
00037 
00038 #endif /* WAN_POOL_H */
